definition: to blow/to play a wind instrument/to blast/to puff/to boast/to brag/to end in failure/to fall through
to extinguish/to put out (fire)/to quench/to stop burning/to go out (of fire, lamp etc)/to come to an end/to wither away/to die out/Taiwan pr. [xi2]

sentences.english: Why do we so often blow out our candles and let the darkness escape to cover up a portion of our glow?
sentences.chinese: 为何我们要吹熄我们的蜡烛让黑暗逃脱来掩盖光明。

sentences.english: The wind tries to take the flame by storm only to blow it out.
sentences.chinese: 风儿一心要用暴风来摄去火焰，不料却将它吹熄。

sentences.english: And the media blew these rumors out of proportion.
sentences.chinese: 只有媒体才能在这块土地上吹熄谣言。

sentences.english: Jane blew out all the candles on her birthday cake at one go.
sentences.chinese: 简一口气就把她生日蛋糕上的蜡烛全吹熄了。

sentences.english: Flavor A quick blow to the head, and it's lights out.
sentences.chinese: 敲开它的头，吹熄它的生命之光。

sentences.english: A puff of wind blew out the candle.
Jane blew the birthday candles out and said a wish for herself.
sentences.chinese: 简吹熄了生日蜡烛，给自己许了个愿。

sentences.english: Anger is the wind that blows out the candle of the mind.
sentences.chinese: 怒气就像一阵风，它会吹熄心灵或想法上的蜡烛。

sentences.english: "For five months a year, the wind stops all tourism, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 一年有五个月，旅游业的景气都被肆虐的强风吹熄。

sentences.english: Jenny blew out the birthday candle.
The stove let out a puff of smoke.
Then he would blow it out and put it carefully away.
sentences.chinese: 然后他会将它吹熄，然后把它小心地走了。

sentences.english: Every time he tried to light the candle, it blew out.
sentences.chinese: 他几次想把蜡烛点了起来，但都被风吹熄了。

sentences.english: Every time he tried to light his cigar, the wind would blow the match out.
sentences.chinese: 每当他试图把雪茄点燃的时候，风总是将火柴吹熄。

sentences.english: Conscience hath somewhat divine in it.
sentences.chinese: 良心是上帝未被彻底吹熄的蜡烛。

sentences.english: Blow out the candles with a shhh.

definition: fire and candles/household things that burn
to extinguish/to put out (fire)/to quench/to stop burning/to go out (of fire, lamp etc)/to come to an end/to wither away/to die out/Taiwan pr. [xi2]
red candle (used during birthdays and other celebrations)
candle light/candle-lit (vigil etc)/candela, unit of luminous intensity (cd)
(to move or do sth) softly and quietly (idiom)
to hold a lamp/to light a lamp
